title: Gael García Bernal slams Trump’s border wall during Oscars
text:
Gael García Bernal took a jab at President Trump without naming him during the Oscars Sunday night.
Bernal, a Mexican-born actor, called out the President’s plan for a border wall while presenting the award for animated feature film.
“Flesh and blood actors are migrant workers. We travel all over the world, we build families, we construct stories, we build life that cannot be divided,” Bernal said.
“As a Mexican, as a Latin-American, as a migrant worker, as a human being, I’m against any form of wall that wants to separate us.”
Breaking from his own tradition, President Trump refrained from live-tweeting the Oscars this year. (Manuel Balce Ceneta/AP) Trump, who refrained from live-tweeting the award show like he has in the past, came up several times throughout the night, including host Jimmy Kimmel’s opening monologue.
“Maybe this isn’t a popular thing to say, but I want to say thank you to President Trump,” he said. “Remember last year when it seemed like the Oscars were racist? That's gone, thanks to him.”
